results.title: Auxiliary views: double auxiliaries
results.creator_credit: Pathescope Company of America and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Begins with a quick view of orthographic projection on three principal planes and on auxiliary planes; then points out that a new condition is introduced if the object to be drawn has a slanting face that is not perpendicular to any of the principal planes. The film shows why a single auxiliary view does not give an accurate picture of an oblique face. The theory of double auxiliary or oblique view is then described in detail, using the visualization effects of combined animated drawings and animated models.

results.title: Auxiliary views. Pt. 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanical Drawing”.
Begins by showing that the three principal views do not represent the true surface of an object that has one or more slanting faces. This condition is shown to require projection of the slanting surface on a plane which is parallel to it and is not one of the principle planes. This auxiliary projection is explained and defined. No other credits available.

results.title: Autumn and cardboard
results.brief_description: An impressionistic and witty portrayal of the election rituals which periodically grip the U.S. electorate - usually in the fall. Using the 1966 Reagan - Brown campaign in California as an example, the film conveys the excitement, rhetoric and rivalry with which the candidates and the issues are presented to the public. Narrated by Lee Marvin. No other credits available.

results.title: Autos, autos everywhere
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, Philip Burton and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
The redesign, computerization and possible elimination of automobiles in the next century is predicted in this film. Experimental models using new power sources, and the trend towards taking responsibility away from human drivers are examined. A partially automated driving system, as well as dual-mode cars which hook up to an electric rail roadway where computers take full control are demonstrated. Major considerations in the prototypes studied are safety, air pollution and traffic congestion. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Autos and all that traffic
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, Jon Wilkman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Presents all aspects of the situation, including: the problems traffic creates, air pollution, new cars to be developed, methods in accident prevention, and new highway planning. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Automation: what it is and what it does
results.brief_description: Explores the meaning and levels of automation from an electric can opener to transfer machines in an assembly line to the more sophisticated feed back of a computer controlled refinery. Encourages the student to explore the implications of increasing automation for the future. Suitable for secondary level.
